result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian J. Fischer

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM Defendant Brian J. Fischer in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. appeared by video for Brian J. Fischer.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Herbers requests an offer in this matter. 
State will email offer over today.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

dated 10/12/22 from Atty Herbers re: zoom appearance.

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 10-13-2022: Approved.**
Authorization to Appear filed by Atty. Andy Herbers
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Apply cash bail previously posted. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

1:07 PM Defendant Brian J. Fischer in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

4:30 PM Defendant Brian J. Fischer not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. The Court will adjourn the initial appearance. Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on September 6, 2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
